name: Uretron D/S

indications.text: uretron d/stablets indicated treatment symptoms irritative voiding . indicated relief local symptoms , inflammation , hypermotility , pain , accompany lower urinary tract infections . indicated relief urinary tract symptoms caused diagnostic procedures .

contraindications.text: adults - one tablet orally 4 times per day followed liberal fluid intake . older children -dosage must individualized physician . recommended children six years age younger .

warningsAndPrecautions: uretron d/stablets blue tablets imprinted `` sat `` one side `` 902 `` opposite side . ndc12539-144-01 , bottle 100 tablets .
adverseReactions: hypersensitivity ingredients possible . risk benefits carefully considered following medical problems exist : cardiac disease ( especially cardiac arrhythmias , congestive heart failure , coronary heart disease , mitral stenosis ) ; gastrointestinal tract obstructive disease ; glaucoma ; myasthenia gravis , acute urinary retention may precipitated obstructive uropathy ( bladder neck obstruction due prostatic hypertrophy ) .
indications_original: Uretron D/Stablets are indicated for the treatment of symptoms of irritative voiding. Indicated for the relief of local symptoms, such as inflammation, hypermotility, and pain, which accompany lower urinary tract infections. Indicated for the relief of urinary tract symptoms caused by diagnostic procedures.
contraindications_original:
Adults - One tablet orally 4 times per day followed by liberal fluid intake.

 
                  
                     Older Children -Dosage must be individualized by physician. Not recommended for use in children six years of age or younger.
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
Uretron D/Stablets are blue tablets imprinted with "SAT" on one side and "902" on opposite side.

 
                  
                     NDC12539-144-01, Bottle of 100 Tablets.
adverseReactions_original:
Hypersensitivity to any of the ingredients is possible.
                  Risk benefits should be carefully considered when the following medical problems exist: cardiac disease (especially cardiac arrhythmias, congestive heart failure, coronary heart disease, and mitral stenosis); gastrointestinal tract obstructive disease; glaucoma; myasthenia gravis, acute urinary retention may be precipitated in obstructive uropathy (such as bladder neck obstruction due to prostatic hypertrophy).
